items.title: BBC News app
items.summary: Top stories, breaking news, live reporting, and follow news topics that match your interests

items.title: NATO says beefing up Baltic presence after Denmark drone sightings
items.summary: Several NATO countries say Russian fighter jets and drones have violated their airspace in Europe over recent weeks, accusing Moscow of testing the alliance.

items.title: New York City Mayor Eric Adams ends his re-election campaign
items.summary: In the video, Mr. Adams did not directly mention or endorse any of the remaining candidates in the race; he warned that “extremism is growing in our politics.”

items.title: Rights group seeks international intervention over killings in Chittagong Hill Tracts
items.summary: The Rights and Risks Analysis Group has said that the Bangladesh Army has been bringing in “outsiders” to settle in the CHT to change the demographics of the region

items.title: Disabled Post Office Horizon victim offered 15% of claim
items.summary: Janet Skinner had a neurological collapse and was temporarily paralysed after her final court hearing.

items.title: Europe survive US comeback charge to win sensational Ryder Cup
items.summary: Captain Luke Donald cements his status as a bona fide Ryder Cup legend as Europe hold of a spirited US fightback to win in New York.

items.title: UGC makes registration on new Study In India portal mandatory for all foreign students
Moldovans cast ballots in a tense election plagued by Russian interference claims
items.summary: The Central Electoral Commission reported more than 400,000 people, or about 14% of eligible voters, had cast ballots by 11 a.m.

items.title: Satheesan urges Centre to intervene in Air India Express service cuts
Government raising awareness on early diagnosis for heart conditions, says Minister
items.summary: On the eve of World Heart Day, Satya Kumar Yadav claims that around 1.41 lakh people with heart conditions receive free medical treatment worth around ₹996 crore through the NTR Vaidya Seva

items.title: Mattanchery police nab Maharashtra man for alleged role in ₹2.8cr. ‘virtual arrest’ scam
RJD, Congress to give up seats in favour of allies in Bihar
items.summary: The RJD-led mahagatbandhan is narrowing down on a seat-sharing formula for the upcoming Bihar Assembly polls, where both RJD and Congress have agreed to give up a dozen seats each to accommodate the now expanded coalition

items.title: Trump hints at ‘something special’ in West Asia talks
items.summary: U.S. President Trump said that “all are on board for something special” in Middle East, with Netanyahu’s visit to White House and plan for Gaza peace

items.title: The picturesque Dutch village set to charge tourists an entry fee
items.summary: Zaanse Schans, popular for its windmills, has a population of just 100 people - but more than two million tourists will have visited this year.

items.title: Heavy rush in Vijayawada on eve of Moola Nakshatram day, traffic diversions in place
items.summary: Thousands of devotees throng the city for darshan of Goddess Kanaka Durga, leading to traffic snarls at major junctions. Officials announce diversions and no-vehicle zones, with tight security for the Chief Minister’s visit to Indrakeeladri

items.title: Faith-driven hunt threatens survival of Telangana’s State bird, Palapitta
How weight-loss injections are turning obesity into a wealth issue
items.summary: With claims of a 'two-tier system', could it be that these drugs are exacerbating health inequalities?

items.title: KVPS slams government for ‘humiliating’ Legislative Council Chairman
items.summary: Moshenu Raju has not been invited to the inauguration of the new Assembly building complex as he belonged to the SC community, the KVPS leaders allege

items.title: Deepavali discount sale begins at Co-optex showroom in Villupuram
items.summary: According to a press release, Co-optex will offer a rebate of 30% on silk and cotton saris sourced from weavers in Coimbatore, Kancheepuram, Salem, Arani, and Tirubhuvanam, among other places.

items.title: Krishna floods: Officials close bathing ghats, stop devotees from taking bath in river
items.summary: Villagers evacuated from Pata Yadlalanka island at Avanigadda; those staying in the downstream of Krishna asked not to cross the overflowing canals and the river on countrymade boats

items.title: LPG consumers can change their suppliers, companies soon
items.summary: Petroleum and Natural Gas Regulatory Board has invited comments from stakeholders and consumers

items.summary: Aim is to educate people the importance of maintaining a healthy heart through lifestyle choices, timely diagnosis, and preventive care

WRD begins restoration of Thalavanur anicut across Thenpennai River
items.summary: Located about 10 km from Villupuram, the anicut had been designed to trap flood waters and help recharge ground water.

items.title: Dharmendra Pradhan calls on CM Nitish in Patna
items.summary: The Union Minister was recently appointed the BJP’s in-charge for the Bihar Assembly election

items.title: RIVER designs mobile app to strengthen rabies surveillance
items.summary: Technical sessions led by experts held subsequently covered a wide range of topics including rabies immunization, animal reservoirs, diagnostic techniques, and the objectives of the National Rabies Control Programme

items.title: At UNGA week, India signals realignment with the Global South

items.summary: The Lt. Governor said demolition of old structures to build new tall buildings was tantamount to burying the city’s cherished heritage.

items.title: Emotional Lowry almost lost for words after crucial Ryder Cup putt
items.summary: Shane Lowry is almost lost for words  following his crucial putt to retain the Ryder Cup for Europe.

items.title: Death toll in Karur stampede rises to 40; Justice Aruna Jagadeesan begins inquiries
items.summary: Of the 40 dead, 17 were women, 14 men, and nine children. Medical teams completed post-mortems on all victims on September 27 night and began handing over the bodies to their families before dawn on September 28

items.title: Karur stampede: VCK seeks ₹50 lakh compensation for victims’ families
Two civilians killed in Ladakh protests cremated amid curfew in Leh
items.summary: The unrest in Ladakh is the BJP’s own creation. The same people who once cheered abrogation of Article 370  now feel betrayed by unkept promises. Youth anger, joblessness, and denial of Sixth Schedule rights have pushed them to the streets

items.title: Arsenal seize 'massive opportunity' by proving mentality
items.summary: Arsenal were in trouble as they trailed Newcastle with six minutes to go - but they are becoming a side who refuse to fold, and it gives them optimism for the challenges ahead, writes Ciaran Kelly.

items.title: Don't underestimate peril for Labour, says Burnham
items.summary: The mayor of Greater Manchester said those calling for loyalty were  "underestimating the peril the party is in".

items.title: Rangers fans still angry but is tanker turning?
items.summary: Rangers fans remain unconvinced by head coach Russell Martin, but was the Ibrox side's victory at Livingston on Sunday evidence of improvement under the Englishman?

items.summary: Merseyside Police says arrests were made on suspicion of supporting the proscribed group.

items.title: Swiss voters narrowly approve plan for electronic ID cards
items.summary: The proposal was backed by 50.4% of voters, in the second Swiss ballot on the issue in four years.

items.title: Jaguar Land Rover may need more than £1.5bn government loan guarantee, MP says
items.summary: Liam Byrne spoke after the government announced it was backing a £1.5bn loan to the company, and warned cyber-attacks could become more common.

items.title: 'It's bigger than us': England aim to inspire after women's Rugby World Cup glory
items.summary: After beating Canada to lift the Women's World Cup in front of a record crowd, England celebrated at Battersea Power Station as they aim to inspire "future Red Roses".

items.title: Lola Young 'doing OK' after collapsing on stage during gig
items.summary: Lola Young was performing at a festival when she appeared to drop her microphone and fall backwards.

items.title: Thunberg denies claims Gaza flotilla is a publicity stunt

items.title: From drug theft to Dubai arrests: The Scottish gangland feud that went global

items.summary: Welcoming the gathering, Ms. Agarwal said that the importance of inculcating healthy habits right from childhood is required.
